channel.title: I needs help with English [Updated]
channel.description:
Hai.
I am somewhat impaired when it comes to the literacy department of my brain, and most humbly request a review of my latest (tortuous) English essay.
It's supposed to be on the development of Australian identity (/suicide). I'm really not happy with it, so any input would be appreciated - from anything from reworded sentences, to suggestions, to a new essay would be great :) I'm already over the word limit (1000), which is depressing :(
Edit: Uploaded an updated version, based on fixes suggested by xxlegitxx, and my own reviewing.

Thanks a lot! I’ll have a look at it now. I don’t blame you for allowing it to slip through your mind without registering - it’s an analytical exposition - nothing more boring on the face of this earth

Here you go
http://rapidshare.com/files/38594821/20_english-learning_ebooks.rar
They are 20books of Learning the English language.
Size:50MB
Wish you luck!
[/quote]Da fuck.

He knows enough English.[/quote]Maybe he wants a playskool trainset?

item.title: I needs help with English [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

It’s a really good essay in terms of grammar and word choice. I have yet to see my peers produce something of this caliber. However, some of the arguments are a tad weak and unsupported, e.g., the larrikin paragraph appeared meaningless (was it there to prove larrikins were lazy? was it there solely to serve as an example of an Australian stereotype - the disregard for authority?). You could drive your arguments home a bit more, and give more thorough purpose to the essay. Tbh, everything went in one ear and out the other; I only read line by line, so I’m sorry if it was a tad judgmental in sizing up your work.

Btw, while searching for evidence to confirm my gut feelings about punctuation and word usage, I chanced upon this article, which may be useful to some extent. I know I’m definitely keeping it and this page handy for the next essay I write.

I reuploaded with inline comments; it’s the easiest way for me to proofread.

Read full topic

item.title: I needs help with English [Updated]
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Yeah, I’m in grade 12 I just need some people to read through and make suggestions for improvement (or improve it themselves if they are in a bored mood ).

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:6, topic:132581”][quote author=exe626 link=topic=183693.msg1668710#msg1668710 date=1186910312]
Age means nothing… I’m 17 in the 10th grade.
[/quote]
How did that work out? I’m 16 going to 12th.
Iamadam, I’m going over for technical errors… I’m too burnt out to revise for content.[/quote]
Thanks, that’d be great

Read full topic
